topic: Cases of Cheating in Kendriya Bhandar
contents:
(a) whether some vendors of Kendriya Bhandar
have cheated and caused pecuniary loss to Kendriya
Bhandar as stated by the OSD(vigilance) in the Office
Order No.KB/5/2020-Vig (Mis-3) dated 6.3.2020; (b) if so, the details thereof and modus-operandi adopted by the said vendors of Kendriya Bhandar; (c) whether the said vendors who have cheated
Kendriya Bhandar have been identified and if so, the
details thereof and the action taken against them; (d) whether the vendor involved in cheating
Kendriya Bhandar are still doing business with Kendriya
Bhandar and they visit Kendriya Bhandar‘s head office
daily and are in constant touch with the management of
Kendriya Bhandar; (e) whether the Secretary(Personnel) CWO and CVO
Kendriya Bhandar have received complaints about the
said fraud happened in Kendriya Bhandar from the
Member(s) of Kendriya Bhandar and Member(s) of
Parliament via e-mail and dak and if so, the details
thereof and the action taken thereon; (f) whether the office of CWO asked CVO Kendriya
Bhandar to take appropriate action in the matter vide
letter No.13/1/2019-Welfare dated 28.6.2021 and if so, the
details of action taken by CVO Kendriya Bhandar in this
matter; and (g) whether the management of Kendriya Bhandar in
collusion with the CVO Kendriya Bhandar and dishonest
vendors have destroyed the forged and tempered store
issue notes and if so, the details thereof?

regard; (c) the effective steps taken by the Government to start the said project at the earliest; (d) the extent to which the construction work in
respect of the first phase of the said project has been
completed and the time by which the remaining works
are likely to be completed; (e) the time limit fixed by the Government in this regard; and  
 . (f) whether the construction work of double-decker
bridge/flyover in Kamthi road is hindered due to non-
completion of construction work under first phase of the
said project and if so, the steps taken to compete the
said work at the earliest?

(a) whether the Government has launched the first
international network of global inter-connected solar
power grid called the Green Grids Initiative - One Sun
One World One Grid; (b) if so, the details thereof including the countries which are a part of this initiative; (c) whether the Government is aware that maintaining
grid stability would be a challenge under this initiative
in view of the evolving nature of geopolitics in the new
world order and changing relationship amongst different
countries and if so, the details thereof; (d) whether such initiative would lead to cost saving
given the fact that supply of energy through the grid
would require electricity to be transmitted thousands of
kilometers and if so, the details thereof; and (e) the time by which the said Green Grids Initiative is likely to be implemented?

(a) whether the Government has undertaken any
projects for enhancing basic amenities in Santhal Pargana
of Jharkhand and if so, the details thereof; (b) the funds earmarked for this purpose during the last three years and the current year; and (c) the time line by which the projects would be completed?

topic: Promotion and Use of New and Renewable Energy
contents:
(a) whether the National Solar Mission has been useful in augmenting the renewable energy; 805 (b) if so, the details thereof and the present share of renewable energy in total requirement of energy; (c) whether the cost of different renewable energy per unit is lower than the conventional energy; (d) if so, the details thereof; (e) the steps taken/being taken by the Government to
bring down the cost of renewable energy, type-wise; and (f) the incentives given to individuals and
institutions to promote generation and use of new and
renewable energy?

topic:
Funds for Shri Guru Ram Das Ji International
Airport
contents:
(a) the details of fund allocated to Shri Guru Ram
Dass Ji International Airport under Krishi UDAN scheme
Launched in year 2020 for exporting agricultural produce
to assist farmers in transporting agricultural products on
international and national routes; (b) whether the Government proposes for a
convergence model or pilot project for catchment of the
said airport, if so, the details thereof and if not, the
reasons therefor; (c) whether the Government announced Amritsar-
Dubai route under Krishi UDAN scheme to enable
transportation of baby corn on this sector and if so, the
details thereof; and (d) whether other products, vegetables, fruits from
Majha region and neighbouring States of Himachal
Pradesh and Jammu and Kashmir catchment are also
being transported from Amritsar airport and if so, the
details thereof?

(a) whether the Government provides any financial
assistance for construction of individual Rain Water
Harvesting Structure(RWHS); (b) if so, the details thereof; and (c) the steps taken by the Government to boost
construction of RWHS at large scale across the country?

topic: Incentive for Early Completion of Road Projects
contents:
(a) whether the Government proposes to provide
bonus of ten percent of the total cost of the road project
to the firms completing the work one year before the
stipulated time in order to incentivise early completion
of the project; (b) if so, the number of projects at present which are
likely to be completed on time or before the stipulated
time; (c) the number of firms which have been provided the said bonus by the Government so far; (d) the number of road projects which are pending
for ten years along with the steps taken by the
Government to complete the said projects; (e) whether ten thousand kilometre stretch of road
is targeted to be constructed during the current financial
year; and (f) if so, whether the said target is likely to be achieved?

topic:
Encroachment on Footpaths in Group Housing
Societies
from: ['Gao, Shri Tapir', 'Bhavana Gawali (Patil), Ms.', 'Jadhav, Shri Sanjay Haribhau']
contents:
(a) whether encroachment on footpaths is increasing
due to commercial activities (opening of milk booth/
departmental store) started/being run by the Government
in Group Housing Societies and particularly in East
Delhi (IP extension) Group Housing Societies and if so,
the details thereof; (b) whether the Government has taken notice of
rising encroachment on footpaths due to opening of
shops and departmental stores in East Delhi (I.P.
Extension) Group Housing Societies; (c) if so, the immediate action taken by the
Government to check the same particularly to check the
encroachment on both sides of the road adjoing the
footpath of Narvana Apartment of Gurudwara road in
Madhu Vihar; (d) whether the Government has formulated any
action plan to tackle the problem of traffic jam on the
roads in these Group Housing Societies in future; (e) if so, the details thereof; and (f) whether any steps are being taken by the
Government to address the problem of encroachment
likely to happen in future due to such commercial
activities and make the footpaths/roads encroachment-
free by removing the encroachment?

topic:
Electricity Demand due to Revival of Business/
Industry
contents:
